1.text: A Psalm or Song for the sabbath day. It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD, and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:

2.text: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,

3.text: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.

4.text: For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.

5.text: O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.

6.text: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.

7.text: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:

8.text: But thou, LORD, art most high for evermore.

9.text: For, lo, thine enemies, O LORD, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

10.text: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.

11.text: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.

12.text: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

13.text: Those that be planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in the courts of our God.

14.text: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;

15.text: To shew that the LORD is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
